name: Fallen Enchantress: Legendary Heroes
description: Fallen Enchantress is a huge fantasy strategy game by the creators of Galactic Civilizations. Recruit heroes, go on quests, train armies, build cities and forge alliances in a rich RPG world. Use the map generator to create a new world each time you play, or the modding tools to create your own world.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 10 / 8 / 7 SP1 / Vista SP2 / XP SP3 Processor: 2.2 GHz Dual Core Processor Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: 512 MB DirectX 9.0c Compliant Video Card w/Pixel Shader 2.0 (Radeon x1600 / GeForce 6800) DirectX®: 9.0c Hard Drive: 5 GB HD space Sound: DirectX 9.0c Compatible Sound Card Additional: To activate this game you must create a Stardock account while launching the game on Steam.

reviews.review_text: i'm not typically a serious fan of city/army builder games like this, but Fallen Enchantress: Legendary Heroes is one of those games that is just what I was looking for at the time. If you're a fan of Sid Meier's Civilization series, this game MIGHT be up your alley. In my opinion, it is way better in many ways. A lot of people say differently... So here's a rundown of why I recommend this game:  1) You get to have a 'main character', which you either pick from, or make your own through customization options. You can also make your own faction up, so to speak and pick your perks etc. 2) There is an EXTREME PLETHORA of troop choices due to customization options to create the exact troop type you are looking for, You can even customize how they look, including gender. Seriously, this is an amazing thing that I haven't seen in too many other games of this type. 3) The battle system is like a hybrid of regular turn-based strategy games of this nature, and something like a less-intricate version of games like Final Fantasy Tactics, Fire Emblem, and Agarest (tactical battle games). See your unique leader and troops battle across actual landscapes, with terrain that affects movement and line of sight in a much more detailed way than typical builder games. Strategize your positions. Feel like you're actually battling!!  There's really only one big problem I have with this game, and that would be the lack of multiplayer... I hear it crashes a lot, but I haven't really had much issue with this. Other than that however, I don't really see a whole lot wrong with it. I saw someone saying it's not a 'completed game' but I felt pretty content with it. I mean, I wouldn't go paying 40 dollars for it but I wouldn't pay that for almost any game, simply because that's a lot of money to me... I don't make that much...  Should you buy this game...? It really depends on what you want in a game. If you're a high-fantasy fan who loves customization and city building, maybe. If you're a fan of grid-based tactical combat games, it just might be up your alley. If you like all of that stuff, you'll probably like this game. Should you spend 40 dollars on it? Ehhhh..... I wouldn't but if you have tons of money to blow, why not? I would honestly wait for a sale, or do some more research beyond my review... I hope i helped you out somehow in your decision however.

Middle market turn based 4X game meets RPG  or in real world terms marriage between Civ IV and King's Bounty series. This is not pure 4X game as 'everybody' claims because there is a heavy role playing.    Pro  + it's turn based 4X and RPG game in one package + 10 predetermined factions and souvereigns are pretty divers + but you can create your own + and you can design units which is my favourite part of game + game is pretty imbalanced so there are various ways of winning + like other Stardock's games, it's highly modable + very high quality mini and total conversion mods + epic music and it's available in mp3 for free + super fast loading + a lot of customization options + I like Battle for Anthys scenario   Neutral  +- both hilarious and semi-compentent AI – they are early pioneer spammers which leads to quick expanding and stealing resources under your nose, but that makes AI settlements to have huge unrest which means totally crippled production and research; some factions are great at quick doom stack spamming (looking at you V.erga) and some are outright terrible every game (those heavy oriented on magic or economy always fail); AI factions use spells mostly ok, and if they have Tornado it's very annoying +- victory conditions (they are standard for these type of games; unfortunately AI is incapable of winning via Dragon Lord quest) +- Stardock account (it's one time registration, it won't pop up ever again) +- diplomacy and trading (I really miss trading, gifting and liberating settlements; otherwise it's mostly good)   Cons  - cheating AI – neutrals almost completely ignore AI factions; above challenger difficulty, AI has economy script; AI dodges frequently your attacks and it's disgusting!; battle's outcomes sometimes don't have any sense: I can lose several units and win then reload and use auto-solve and lose nothing. - terrible lagging when fighting in jungle/forest map (come on, it's turn based!) - terrain doesn't matter in tactical mode (standing behind rock or trees doesn't matter) - settlements can't cross river (unless modded) - it doesn't make sense - there are huge water surfaces but there is no way to cross them - bugs, bugs and more bugs (always save max after 2 turns because of unexpected bugs and cheating AI) - crossbows are completely useless - Fallen Enchantress scenario is the huge waste of time - DLCs are mostly worthless or/and bugged (Map and Quest Pack are only worth)   Final score:  8/10 and recommended for buying base game (no DLCs outside Quest and Map!).    Mandatory mini mods:  Parrottmatth mods (Snaking Mod, River City Bridge, Swamp Tiles, Armored Militia, Armor Attributes, Summoner Unit, Female Henchman), Black Market Bazaar, Level 6 and 7 Cities, Armor Visuals, AI Plus, Name Generator, More Visible Move Radius in Tactical, Dragon Taming for LH and Beast Mode.

Civilization meets Heroes of Might and Magic. A decent 4x game with an indepth combat/hero system and the ability to make your own units. The cell shaded art style will be loved by some and hated by others. No multiplayer but still a pretty cool world filled with enough magical creatures and stuff for at least a few playthroughs. There is no multiplayer, just a freeplay/sandbox mode and two scenarios.

This game was a lot of fun. At first it was a little hard and I didn't know what to do. I quickly lost my first scenario as I was overrun by both wild creatures and enemy forces, but I felt like I learned from that first atempt. I used my new knowldege to fire up the same scenario again. This time I got much further but eventually I lost again. With each defeat I learned more and used that knowledge to improve my game. I learned that when I make custom units if I want to be able to upgrade them to plate mail later I need to give them the plate mail ability even if my current armour is only leather.I also learned that once a unit is trained as a foot soldier of some type it can not be given a mount latter on (I don't like that rule but knowing it helps out).   there are small differance between the factions but I don't really see that much of a differeance between how the factions play. The biggest differeance is the Sovierng you start with.   I wish there was some form of multiplayer even if it was hot seat. I also wish there was naval units/war fare. Whenever you run into a body of water there is no way to hop on a boat and travel. Still I've had lots of fun playing this game. Especially when fighting dragons and other big optional bosses on each map.

Fantastic strategy game from Stardock the gods. They are responsible for maybe the greatest space strategy game of all time, Galaactic Civilization II. Things did not go as planned with Elemental, a game that had a ton of good ideas but in the end was to ambitious and way to many bugs. What does stardock do after that? well they give the fans the enxt 3 games FREE. Legendary Heroes is a awesome game and one of hte best strategy games of the last few years. Stardock listens to there fans and there fans love htem for it, if you want a new strategy game with rpg elements pick this up! Stardock has also helped made and publish the wonderful SINS OF A SOLAR EMPIRE. Support great devs people!

Love empire building games. I was a loyal civ man.  10 hours in to this game, I knew I may never play civ again I still havent all the DLC is worth it in my mind only complaint is AI. . . so predictable. . . and so stupid almost no advantage is too big to be squandered! still though its pretty great 9/10

It's like if Civilization IV's Fall From Heaven 2 mod and heroes of might and magic had a baby.   except the story is much weaker than FFH2's (Which to be fair had an outstanding story). And the game is much easier.   this is a very easy game singleplayer, the AI is bad. Everything else is fairly fun. If you can take it for a ride on multiplayer it can be fantastic.   get it on sale, it's worth it.

An interesting, fun and at times difficult game, Fallen Enchantresses only downfall is it's lack of online mode. The campaign mode is solid if not limiting, white the freeplay is where this game really shines. The chance for customizing your faction and nation are plentiful and satisfying, with different races, selectable traits and customizable units. The game is open to modding, with a fairly active online modding community, although there is no steam workshop built in so you may have to be a little tech savvy.

RPG. TACTICAL COMBAT. STRATEGY.  With over 300 improvements and enhancements to Fallen Enchantress, Legendary Heroes takes the spiritual successor of 'Master of Magic' to even more astonishing heights of great gameplay.  You can custom make your own units, your own sovereign (hero unit), heck you can even make your own entire faction.  One of the great 4x games in existence.  Downside: it has some stability issues.  8/10
Very 'Master of Magic' gameplay, pretty cool cell shaded graphics. Check out the 'Children of Storm' to add mucho content.

its kinda like a cid meirs civilisation game mixed with a tactics based RPG in a fantasy world. you even can create your own leader character like in a RPG and make your own race, then make your own units in game.  legendary heros makes FE good.... if you have origional fallen enchantress (elements?) then legendary heros is just like that BUT more refined, character level ups are better, you can see experience gain after combat, combat is actually playable with more skills and even skills for non magic attack based on weapon loadout. its like the origonal wasnt finished and was shabby and legendary heros is the true full fixed game.

This is my favourite 4X game right now. Has so many awesome features. Design your own leader/sovereign, customise your cities even more then most 4X games. Pick abilities for champions, design your own units. Quests, monster lairs, loot. There are a few bugs that I have encountered while playing the game e.g. reloading a save game will hide territory borders with no way to get them back other then restarting the entire game afaik.   Even with the bugs, the game is just too fun to me for it to be that much of a bother. Definitely recommended for any lover of 4X games. You will not be disappointed. It is worth your money.

There was a previous incarnation or two of this game and this one plays in a similiar vein to the previous versions. Set up a 'colonly', build a few buildings and expland your territory. There is a party adventure mode as well that lets you explore your world, upgrade your adventurers, and collect items to equip them with. The campaign could use some work though... a bit more depth, cut scenese, voice overs, ect. But really I bought this game for the map editor and sandbox mode. After awhile (40 hours) it does tend to get repetative. That said I was intrigued enough to play each sandbox custome game to see each individual ending related to that vicotry condition. If there was a way to infuse 'more story' into the game it'd be a real gem. The only knock against this game is if you play the 'huge' map setting. I have an advanced gaming rig that starts to chug and eventually crash if the world is overly populated with cites.  An 8 out of 10. If the developers would add cutscences and some RPG elements it could easily climb to a 10 out 10. The expansion packs seem focused towards 'new loot' and different AI characters to play against. They don't really add very much to the gaming experiance so only buy them if you have a couple extra bucks collecting dust.
Very fun but not worth 40 dollars wait for a sale

For anybody who loves strategy, this game is definitely a must have. It mixes interesting strategic combat with a Civilization like overworld, all while providing that RPG feeling. On top of that, it is highly customizable and even has a couple of mods.
Very nice game. Heroes + Civ = FE :)

I think it's official: I really like this game. I've played nothing else for the past two weeks. The game has a great deal of tactical depth, there are tons of different development options for heroes, cities, and a great deal of flexibility designing units. This is Stardock's 3rd kick at the can for this series, but it seems to have finally come together really well for this, the third iteration.

Until AoW3 picks up their end and put some Omph into it, this game will keep you way satisfied. It has a solid just one more turn-obession somewhere in it, and also dragons. The kind that will turn you and your couch into one pile of ashes if you are not prepared for it. And that, is before you get any DLC.

Really fun turn based game with tactical battles - the standout for this game is the use of magic which adds nicely to the overall game without feeling too strong or insignificant.  If you like games like Civilization and Heroes of Might and Magic, you will probably like Fallen Enchantress: Legendary Heroes a lot. 8/10.
Plays well. Plenty of replayability.

Have you ever played any CiV game and thought something was missing? Or that the combat was boring? then you might give fallen enchantress a try where it lacks in historical contents it makes up for it in Customization in a high fantasy theme. The battles are turn based HoMM style, so you get to see those high priced unit in all their splendor. Also there are a couple of mods that do enrich the content in terms of units and playable Kingdoms/empires.   CONS: NO multyplayer (personally not a fan of it anyway in this type of games)  Graphics are hit and miss but again it makes easy for the modders to add a TON of content. Fullscreen is not fullscreen (its a borderless window regardless of setting).

Do you like the Civilization game series? How about Heroes of Might and Magic? Think of this game as their 'not the sharpest knife in the drawer' child.   Fallen Enchantress: Legendary Heroes tries to be a game of both City-Building and Turn-Based-Combat. Unfortunately it does both of these in wonderful mediocrity. Neither aspect of the game is fleshed out fully and this leaves you somewhat unsatisfied in both arenas.   That being said, the game is not without merit. While it's not as deep as other games, it's a decent way to scratch your TBS itch. The character models are decent and the inclusion of a fantasy setting makes the city-building interesting when starting out. The game isn't worth the asking price of $40, but if you see it on sale for $10 or less, it's probably worth your time if you're a fan of Civilization and TBS games.

I have very positive experience with this game. Characters, heroes, equipment of the troops, etc. are detailed enough. Empire building and towns are implemented well. Research is logic, benefit is useful. All in all, I recommend this game.

Civilization meets Heroes of Might and Magic. Fallen pulls off this combination at about 75% of both games. It does leave some elements of both to be desired but overall I still enjoyed the game play. Given enough options for character and kingdom design I will revisit this game in the future.

FE:LH is honestly one of my more favored fantasy 4X games with pretty tight, but simple RPG mechanics and a good variety between factions.  It's far from perfect; but it has the typical Stardock level of reliability to it; though I've found it to be a bit on the easy side, generally.

This game is obscure, even for a 4X. We all know our Civilizations or Dominions or Alpha Centauris, but I barely know anyone who's heard of this, let alone played it. That being said, this game could be described a rough diamond. The game has some glaring balance issues, and it's a good bit glitchy at times, but the gameplay is solid and rewarding.  Every game begins like any Civilization game, where you found your capital city and then start to explore the world. However, instead of your standard units like Civilization has, you have customized units that you can design yourself. You also have heroes, which are specialty one-man armies that will join your cause from time to time.   If you've played Age of Wonders III, the combat is remarkably similar. When you enter battle, both factions are placed on the opposite side of the battlefield, and you move them into play until they're in range to strike.   The world itself is incredibly detailed. On almost every playthrough, I'll run into a quest or monster that I've never seen before, and every game spawns one of four special areas of the map where you can fight boss-type monsters and aquire extremely rare treasure. Every game brings something new.  PROS:  - Incredibly varied worlds - Good combat system - Lots of 'fluff'  - Wide variety of artifacts and weapons - Useful character creator  CONS:  - Some factions just plain suck - Game can be glitchy, particularly when loading saves - Soundtrack's rather forgettable   FINAL VERDICT  First off, buying this game with all the DLC will leave you homeless. When our Lord and Savior Gaben blesses this software with the glorious green of a sale, snatch it up as soon as you can. You won't be disappointed.
I really enjoy playing this game and with each DLC release, I enjoy it again. Great replayability.

I tried it because it was a free weekend so why not and I have to say I'm defenately buying this game now. Perfect mix of civilization with tactical turn based fantasy combat that keeps me saying just a few more turns, then I'll go to bed. As if that wasn't enough my jaw just about dropped to the ground when I saw the character, faction and unit customization options. So if you like civilization games, turn based games, empire building games and/or strategy games you can't go wrong with this title.

I read all of the negative write ups and decided to give it a try anyway. I love the game. The AI is lacking and it will just spam attack you once it starts but there is so much to like about it, unit customizing, so many options with your cities, many choices can impact you later. I love the game and I think I'll be playing this one for a long time.
Only recommended if you wanna get hooked! I played for 29hours in 2 days, where i should have done homework etc instead!
Very good game, keeps me entertained for ages.
One of the best Fantasy Civ-builders i have played.
The game gets better with each patch. Perfect sandbox type of game. Keep up the good work.

What a fun game!! Played this alot. This game has 2 parts. The role playing hero system which is fun and the strategic, 4x element with many units (all customizable) and the battle map which give it a old school Master of Magic feeling.
You got your Civilization in my Might & Magic! No, you got your Might & Magic in my Civilization! Two great games that play great together.
Fantastic 4x game, much like master of magic.
Mod it until crash . .
This Game is amazing.
Fallen Enchantress is very powerful game when it comes to strategy and I reccommend playing it if you are a experienced gamer.
Started out rough but really solid game now!

This game takes me back to the days when I played Age of Empires and Civilization. I enjoyed the feeling of nostalgia that came with playing this game. I also very much enjoyed the enhanced gameplay with combat and equipment to buy, sell, and loot. This aspect gave the game a bit of RPG feel.
its concept like civilization but who else want to become dragon slayer should play this 10/10
worth $1 for the humblebundle, not worth $39.99.   Good news is this thing is always on sale.
not bad at all, watching the hours go by

As a 4x strategy game, it is definitely behind Civ IV and probably lags behind Civ V as well. That said, the hero feature is done extremely well and ends up playing like a HoMM melded with a slightly watered down Civ title. For fans of both types of games this is a must purchase. Warlock is also a fantasy based 4x but FE:LH is far superior in my opinion. It just seems 'bigger,' and not just because of map size.
Simply put, it's like a combination of Civilisation and Heroes of Might & Magic. If those are your kind of games give this a go, it's a safe bet that you'll enjoy it.
worth $1 for the humblebundle, not worth $39.99.   Good news is this thing is always on sale.
A fun cross between a civilization like turn based strategy game and might and magic style heroes and combat.
Great little game, Just wish it had multiplayer is all. I'd reccomend it of course.

A all around solid game tons of things to do in the style of masters of magic. Graphics are good amd do not bother me. I am more concerned with replayability and content. The game is not disapointing me yet

It was kinda hard for me to decide if I recommend this game. It's like Civilization and Fire Emblem had a hard baby. This game is very difficult, and it crashes sometimes, but it's a good game. Just hope no one plants outposts all around your first city.

I was a bit reluctant when testing this game, but now that I have played it for 7 hours I must say that for a turn based game it's quite entertaining. The quest mode is fun also and made me think of Might and Magic. If you enjoy a nice and long paced yet tactical game, than this might be something for you. The graphics are ok, the scenary is zoomable (meaning you can see it old board game style or close 3D feel like), voices of the chars are funny and the minions are various.  To me it's all I seek in this type of games :)

Great game, like the mixture of city building and the RPG turn based combat in a fantasy based world. If you like Civ type city maintance, RPG turn based combat, and killing big dragons and such, this game will fill all of those needs quite well. I've got well above my monies worth out of it.
It was pretty fun. I'm not going to say I DIDN'T like it. I think there are better 4x games out there. Pretty solid though.
A good turn based game. It has no mutiplayer support or it would be great.

This is like Civilization with trolls, dragons and old gods instead of cavemen and animals as wandering monsters - magic instead of technology - but the same just-one-more-turn addictive qualities. The previous version had many faults, but this one is maybe as good as the best civs. Fantastic game!

I played the original Fallen Enchtress and then I picked this up. This has the polish the first was missing (managing city expansion, better unit promotion, better hero accumluation, unit weapons feeling different, etc.). It still is lacking a lot of polish though.  I have played the Civ games since Civ 2, and this is reminisent of a Civ light mechanics (tech tree, placing cities, cultural borders, corruption/unhappiness/ unrest, city improvements the list goes on). It reminds me of Lords of Magic (an old game) updated with a Civ like interface.  From a mechanics standpoint and Polish I keep not wanted to reccomend the game - poor graphics, poor AI, no multiplayer, etc. I really should just put in Civ every time to get the polish I am looking for, but I don't. I come back to this game periodically because it is fun to outtech everyone or summon 10 scouting towers on the map in a turn. This is definitely a game to pick up on a steam sale, but if you like RPGs and you like Civ then consider this game.
The expansion has fixed several issues with balance, and improved the AI substantially. Worth the price of admission.

Civilization and Age of Wonders had a baby? I think so. It would be heresy to compare it to Masters of Magic though...   The unit customizer is one of my favorite feature. Sometimes its to make best use of your materials available and sometimes its just to be a bit silly. In one game i had a severe shortage of metal, but plentiful crystal and horses. What was the end result of this you say? Why obviously club wielding knights with wizard robes and enchanted cloaks.  I've spent countless hours playing this game because there is just so much to explore. If you are a RPG fan and enjoy Grandscale Turn-based strategy games, this one is a must buy.
You like Civilization? You like turn-based RPG fights?  This is your game.   It combines building a huge Empire with training customizable units and heroes to fight for your territory.

Nice tweaks from the base game Fallen Enchantress. This really should have been an expansion instead of calling it a new game though.   I did run into a nasty collision bug that would prevent me from ending my turn and thus halting play. Spent a good 30 minutes on the forums figuring out how to bypass it.   Other than that - great game. I particularly like the option to fight turn based in tactical combat rather than the autoresolve die roll that is typical in these Civ-like games. Definitely would recommend going straight for Legendary Heroes rather than just Fallen Enchantress.
Solid game if you enjoyed Master of Magic eons ago.
If you loved Master of Magic you will like this game. It is not a perfect successor to MoM but it is the closest I have seen so far.
A very good update to an already very nice game. This fixed the major issues of F.E. and expanded upon it, what more can you want?
I really like this game.

My first foray in to 4x turn based strategy games. Quite enjoyed the time I spent in this one - had some nice abilities and liked being able to build my own units. Cons: Bad AI and you pretty much have to play the same way every time.

while I do recommend this game I have a few things to note about. It has a few fairly noticable bugs. like I had to avoid the tutorials because they made my screen black out entirely. And the user interface I felt was terrible and horribly scattered. I also wish that building custom stuff was simpler but eh. get past that and the character customization was decent and the abilities on leveling were okay. It wasn't that fast paced and the research tree was a little gawdy. But the fantasy appeal of Dragons, epic weapons, epic creatures and crushing cities to dust kept me hanging on. overall I would say 5/10. I would play one whole game. But it's hard to get past critical design flaws and ugly UI.
Heroes of Might and Magic III and Civilization IV combined
This is more RPG than 4X, but it is still worth a look if you like the genre
Civ 5/GalCiv 2, but with fantasy and magic. Graphics are meh, but the gameplay is first rate!
Awesome strategy game!!!!!!!

If you like Medieval Fantasy themed games and you enjoy X4 games like Civilization then you got the best combination of both right here in this game: smart AI, great variety of game play options, plenty of (useful) research to do, city building and management, heroes, great magic, tactical combat, quests... Believe me, you won't be disappointed!

I loved the game; very entertaining combination of civilization, magic and rpg elements. However I think it lacks depth. After 10 hours it is the same thing over and over again.   I wish they added more strategy to battles and I would love to see city battles to be more interesting (walls and civilians for instance).  Still, a good buy.
This is a great hybrid civ-builder / rpg turn-based game. I'm loving this. Highly recommended.
Great game, mixing the addictive qualities turn-based strategy and RPGs. It doesn't support multiplayer, though, even though it says it does.

Solid game, that the work put into it is finally starting to show some polish. The series started off as a complete buggy disaster, but the developers came out and admited to it, and have worked since to have a rather nice product. The game is definitely playable, and has substantially fewer bugs, so if you have played 'Elemental War of Magic' or Fallen Ehnchantress, you may want to give this game a second chance.  Pros: Tons of Cusomization - Customize Factions, Leaders, Units.  Polished Skill Tree allows for Leaders and Heros not to get neutured.   Cons: Fairly battle orintated. Diplomacy is a Mystery Research the DLC before you get it.
Great Game

I'm a long time fantasy 4x fan (mom, aow...etc) & this one is my favorite Interesting mix of heavy PvE (the world) & PvP (the AI) that feels like two different games; easy to become lost in one but balance must be maintained ftw. Great customization options. Great art style.  Do you 4x? Do you fantasy? If yes, then buy this.

Granted, there where problems with this game and bugs where many, but now all seems well, and the game is very, very good. For anyone thinking of buying I would say it's a bargain, for the amount of fun and pleasure it will bring to you.
Legitimate heir to classic Masters of Magic from the 1990's.
Great fun, re playable, fully control everything on it.
The game is alot of fun to play. Very reminescent of the Heroes of Might and Magic series. For the price and fun it can't be beat.

Fun 4x game in fantasy setting. Has some nice RPG elements and good customization for heros and units. Some mechanics could use some polish but they still update to fix things. Overall good game for the money lots of replayability.

Bought this game while it was on sale. BUT, now that I've played it, I would have EASILY payed full price for it. If you enjoy STARWARS: EMPIRE AT WAR, then you should enjoy this...Lots of customization, monsters, quests, and just a hell of a lot of fun! Hours and Hours of game play!

If you like strategy games then this is a great buy. With a wide variety in playing styles and customizations available it adds both a story line to premade hero factions and almost infinite possible to creating your own faction. This is more than just a game of conquering a broken land but if you listen there are clear quest lines and plots to be found. Both competitive and tactical with the capability of a skilled player you can go into a battle with the unit disadvantage and come out on top with unit placement in real time combat.

Decent game, very very similar to the previous Fallen Enchantress game, but theyve added a few new mechanics, changed some old ones and also improved the interface and updated the graphics and models a bit... Overall it is an improvement over the previous game, but $40 is a bit steep, I paid $20 since I own Fallen Enchantress, but I'm sure in a few months there will be a special for around 12-15bucks... Another negative is that the game is fairly buggy and it crashes regularly... Still... content-wise, this game is waaaaaay better than Heroes of Might and Magic 5 and all its DLCs..... A must buy if you love turn based RPG strategies :)

Fallen Enchantress is an awesome 4X turn-based strategy/sorta-RPG game. One thing that I enjoy about the game is that it’s VERY different from other fantasy 4X games in a number of key ways.  First, it takes place many years after the world was devastated by a war of magic – it’s essentially a post-apocalyptic fantasy world. Virtually everything concerning magic and technology had been lost (technology in this case being the standard medieval-level of weaponry and military tactics). You’re leading a rag-tag group of survivors to build your faction’s first city and begin to rebuild. Of course, you were chosen as leader because you are one of the only people remaining who can wield magic.  Secondly, there’s none of the standard Orcs, Goblins, Elves, Dwarves, blah blah blah that have become standard fare for fantasy games. The races are all (with the exception of Men) completely original, as are most of the bestiary that pose a constant threat outside of the safety of your cities. However, the game makes all of the new races and creatures easy to understand with a very thorough and easy-to-access online guide that seamlessly integrates lore and story with game mechanics. Want to know what the Trogs can do before you play as them? Just hover over the attribute marker reading TROG BLOOD in the character roster and see their benefits and disadvantages. Got an army of Brood Hunters headed for a city? Just click on the army on the map and click their profile to read all about them and see their stats.  Also, virtually everything is customizable. Make new leaders, new factions, new units. Just researched Warg Riding and want to make some cavalry? Just pop into the unit design screen and design them, what armor they wear and what weapons they carry, etc. Just make sure you have a source of Wargs handy – depending on what weaponry and armor you give your units, you may need a variety of resources (metal, horses/Wargs, magic crystal, etc) to create them. These can be found on the map and brought under control of your cities by building on them.  All-in-all, it’s a great game that slipped under the radar to a certain extent.

A great fantasy 4x game with turn based strategy battles. A lot of customization options and RPG like quests for your characters to go on. The graphics, sound, and UI are all well done. Solid game! If you think you *might* be interested just pick it up! They did a great job with this one!
I really like this game.

Master of Magic... on steroids. Seriously this is the best contender I have seen for a new version of the classic. The level of customisation of your units is great (eve if a bit redundant as you will tend to go with certain choices every time) especially given sometimes you will have limited access to metal or crystals so you can change you soldiers gear accordingly. I find the mechanic of limiting where you can build cities very annoying but other than that it is a great game!
Great turn base, Fun, with large maps and tons of items, monsters, and little quests you can do for special spells and such. Definately a five star.

I got this game for 10$ cad on sale, and for that price it no doubt good. The game does get repetitive and the AI is not good at all. You can simply turtle through the game even on the 2nd highest difficulty. I haven't bothered with the highest difficulty yet, but I'm sure it is the same because the AI simply gets more resource boosts. The devs also seem to have a habit of rehashing their games a lot, this being the 3rd iteration of Elemental. I have not played Elemental or Fallen Enchantress, but I have read that they are almost the same as FE: Legendary Heroes.   I got this game at 75% so I was not disappointed, at 10$ there is still ample play and it is a good deal, but in the long run I would rather play Master of Magic, which seemed to have a bit more depth and more variety of creatures and magic.   Edit: This game is no where near as good as Age of Wonders III. I will still leave a positive recommendation because I got this game for 10$ on sale, and because they game isn't completely horrible. The ai never seems to try and attack and that is the biggest problem with this game.

After a couple doven hours of gameplay during the 3-day trial I had, I tested most of the functions this game has to offer. They blew me away completely. Unlike other games that follow a similar style, this game's combat and story-line capability, along with insane customization, made even the renowned Civ5 look childish to me. I highly recommend this game to anyone who enjoys the style, as it is a refreshing change of pace from the idle-gameplay and drudgery of normal 4x's. Find a style that fits you, create your own ideal Empire or Kingdom, and conquer all on your path.

Fallen Enchantress: Legendary Heroes is an ambitious games. It brings many new things to the 4X genre, but fails to execute them perfectly. For years, I've looked for a nice Masters of Magic remake, and got frustrated with all the attempts that claimed to add a personal touch, while ruining the magic formula of the masters of magic. FE:LH also adds a unique touch, but unlike others, it succeeds in becoming something at least as good as MoM.  As I've mentioned, the execution of the new ideas aren't perfect, you get balancing issues and even bugs, but I think the game is still very unique and enjoyable if you're a fantasy 4X fan.
I will be looking for challengers of all caliber. I promise to teach those new to the genre~
VERY fun, has some surprises just when you don't expect. I love the variety of magic items, spells, heroes, research etc. Playing MANY hours and loving it!
Civ + Heroes of might n magic.. what's not to like? ...

Not impressed. This game hits you from the start with unwanted hassle. You must create an additional user account on the developers servers to play the game. I don't want that. If a game is on Steam, it shouldn't need anything extra. No additional DRM or more accounts or anything. They want you to have an account so they can sell you tiny-expansions, which are annoyingly advertised in-game.  Then you start the game and find out it is unbalanced in a dozen ways.I have gone through the motions of playing the game, and It really just isn't fun. Maybe it's because I have played dozens of games like it (that are better or more interesting).  The designers created a complicated lore/item system, but forgot to make the game mechanic interesting.  I bought this on a steam sale. Still disappointed that I spent money on it. Still annoyed about having to create an extra account that I get emails for. Still annoyed at the publisher Stardock software.  4/10. If I was on a hypothetical deserted island and this was my only game.. I would play it. I guess.

This game is very similar to tactical strategy games like Heroes of Might and Magic and King's Bounty.  What it adds is civilization elements such as choosing technological paths, civic production, and unit design. What it loses is interesting combat, reasonable game lengths, software stability, and user interface.  There are some flaws that are particularly aggravating. The game decides on its own when a player has completed his turn and automatically enters the AI cycle, often when the player isn't completely finished. The spells seem to range from worthless to overpowered without managing to make the combat more interesting. Above all, a lot of turns are just spent doing nothing while waiting for construction to complete.  I'd suggest looking to King's Bounty: Armored princess or Heroes of Might and Magic III (or 4) before this game.

When I try to play the game I get the following error message: 'The product appears to be validated but the machine SID doesn't match. Try deleting the file H:\Steam games\common\FE Legendary Heroes\sig.bin and re-activating.' I assume this is due to a hardware change I've performed recently. Unfortunately the file I've been linked to doesn't exist and I end up with a broken game I can not play anymore.  As a direct result of this experience I'll refrain from purchasing Stardock Entertainment products in future. I can't stand companies which prevent their customers from playing their games because of some poorly designed DRM-♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t. Hence I'll treat you the same way I treat Ubisoft since they've pestered me with U-play in Assassins Creed II. I will avoid your products from now on and will advice my friends to do the same.

This is a really, really good game. It's a lot like Civ5, if Civ5 let you summon massive volcanos under enemy cities.  Don't buy it.  Why?  Because it's barely playable. It crashes constantly. That would be bearable, but every few times it crashes it locks up my system, forcing me to restart. Also, Stardock apparently has no plans to fix this well known and extremely common issue. They're to busy trying to sell their new game, and have abandoned this one like they did the two before it.  Oh yeah, speaking of their new game, thay advertise it on the main menu of this one. For some reason it really annoys me to have to look at an ad embedded in a game I paid for.

If you want strategic depth and variety buy Endless Legend instead of this.  If you want tactical depth and variety buy Age of Wonders 3 instead of this.  This does neither the strategic or tactical layer well but both in a very mediocre and uninteresting way. Ive tried to enjoy this and its earlier iteration but have failed due to its ultimately bland gameplay.
Game has flaws if it wasnt for the glitches id say it was a good game still needs polishing.
Do not buy: Stardock DRM.
I like the gameplay. All of it. I do not like the CTD bugs. As long as the game has been out it should not still have CTD bugs.

I own all Elemental games, and while this is by far the best of them, it never grew on me. I love 4X games, and probably own most of the known ones, but this one feels like it's lacking something.  **A few points:**  * tons of content in this game: items, loot, weapons, spells, there's a lot of them; * mob variety: a lot of variety, and they scale well among all levels and all of them have a little flavor description; * total lack of empire management: nothing at all; no 'empire plan' or 'social policies' or 'virtues' or anything similar to adapt your empire; * diplomacy is rather dull and almost useless, because every AI will eventually hate you and want to kill you because of such modifiers as 'we want to establish order to the world' which makes them want to destroy you even if they are your ally. You cannot play peacefully in this game, you will be rolled over if you don't maintain a huge army at all times; * quests on the map: similar to Endless Legend, only way more boring and uninteresting. They have huge amount of uninteresting text. The Endless Legend ones seem a lot more compelling and they tie in to the lore of the game, not here; * combat is dull: there's a *swarm* mechanic, where all your adjacent units will attack an enemy, but that's about the only twist there is to it. The combat itself is not bad, and spells are actually interesting and strategic, but the presentation of the combat is dull and all units looking almost the same doesn't help either; * performance: surprisingly poor for the look of the game. The engine is much more optimized then it was before, I have reported the issue a long time ago and Brad, the CEO of Stardock took personal interest in fixing this, and they did, but still I get the same FPS as in Farcry 3 so this might be an issue for some people; * turn wait time: almost inexistent because the AI things while you take your turn and just executes the moves when you press the button; * late game is a nightmare: there are no governors for the cities and destroying the cities can only be done after 5 turns after it has been conquered. Also, destroying a city, leaves 'fertile' ground where the AI could build another one; * developing cities is honestly as dull as it is in Age of Wonders 3: you choose one of three specializations: Science, Military/Production or Growth/Money and from then on you just build the specialized buildings in the same order, you can just queue them for 100 turns, it makes no difference; * race differentiation: very little; they all look the same, except for some DLC ones, and the only difference is in bonus stats and sometimes a unique unit or building. Nothing even remotely close to the extent of Endless Legend;  That being said, I cannot recommend this game, because there's Endless Legend and Age of Wonders 3. They're both better games for different reasons: Endless Legend for civilization building and economy and trade and diplomacy, and Age of Wonders 3 for the superb combat and unit variety and that sense of fantasy adventure.

This isn't a bad game, but there are better things out there (now) in the same genre. If you want a hex-map settlement/empire game, go get Civilization V, and if you want that in a fantasy variety, go get Endless Legend-- both of these are similar to Fallen Enchantress but easier to use due to better user interface elements.

I really enjoyed this game, and was having fun, until I added some of the DLC content through steam. I read that other people were having problems with the game crashing, but I never had an issue. However, as I said, once I added the Undead DLC the game is crashing left and right, whether I am playing the new DLC content or not.   It's discouraging that a good game was made unplayable by the DLC, now I am trying to figure out if there is a way to get a refund.
Honestly, Civilization V with all the DLC is cheaper (around $10 on sale) and overall better. Fallen Enchantress: Legendary Heroes feels like it's lacking and the combat system is just distasteful.

So I actually killed a day playing this game. Needless to say, I wont be buying it. While im using a pentium i3 with 8gb of memory, the game ran OK, but ending a turn generally took about 10-20 seconds to process everything. You will be ending turns ALOT in this game because everything takes forever to make.  I decided to forgo the tutorial and quickly realized this was a civ style game. Unlike civ, you can only build cities on green tiles that have resources. Due to a mistake I made with my settlers by clicking the outpost button, and the inability to undo a turn I was left at a disadvantage while it took another 6 turns to produce another settler. During this time, the AI hemmed me in and I was stuck to two cities the whole game. I kept playing thinking I could research and negotiate my way out of it. Impossible.  After researching everything I needed to earn capital quickly, I paid the most powerful player to declare war on my neighbor. This had virtually no effect as they both continued to grow more powerful. I should have known because when my neighbor declared war on me, his army consisted of two scouts and three archers and that was it. All of the AI's soldiers were garrisoned in the cities with 400+ attack power. With a limitation of 6-7 slots in an army and NO system for reinforcing one army with another it becomes impossible to dislodge them.   After figuring out how rigid the game is, I just stopped playing. A day wasted, but money saved.

Someone tried to mix Civilization with HoM&M, not successfully. I'd rather play Warlock Master of Arcane serie.  - obscure interface,  - maps feel very small and not interesting, there was not enough space for another city on medium map, wtf? I could build outposts for resources at the least. - shallow combat, imho failed unit initiative system, - no hexes, neither on main map nor battle map - Civ manages well without them I admit, but not the case here, - no separate city view and not clikable buildings, not even a tooltip what it is and what it does. - obscure interface (doubly so), especially city management (wait, there is city management at all?)  Disclaimer: I played during free weekend and I cannot recommend what I tried to like. Maybe on sale? And I hate wasted potential in games, so common these days.

This is a great game in the making. If you like early access games this might be for you.  The problem is, this isn't an early access game. This is the predecessor of this game, with minor patches. The changes and added content in this 'stand alone expansion' are an order of magnitude less than what I've ever seen in any expansion, stand alone or otherwise.  And the game itself is only 75% done - it is still unfinished, unbalanced, and riddled with more bugs than any finished game should have in the late Beta phase.   The things that are unfinished are: - A ridiculous amount of bugs (e.g. wrong camera perspective in worldmap until you restart, missing tooltips that should tell you how strong the enemy is, cannot select a unit until you restart, music stops until you restart, game crashes, etc), usually I encounter about 2 of these per hour. - Performance (runs very slow on Haswell integrated graphics) - AI is very very weak - Lategame gameplay not interesting, due to bad balance and AI - Manual and in-game help incomplete, not usable  A few balance changes and A LOT of bugfixes, and this game would be good. Add in a decent AI and it would be great. Unfortunately it doesn't have these and never will, so thumbs down.

Do not waste your money on this game. It tries to be a complex game without finding any harmony between its elements. You'll find yourself stranded in walls of text tries to figure out what anything does.

its a very fun game to play! but this game does not work for me any more. its crashing before i can even get to the main menu. i really want this fixed if at all possible. im an active member of steam and there third partys, please help me with this problem and restore the security i have with there services and there third partys.

My experience with this game is as follows:  1) Unable to actually demo the game on first day (see well known issue with Steam offer re Jan 2015 promo). Tried many times to launch the game but alas, it wouldn't ....but I wasn't put off.  2) Tried to load game again on second day. Apparently, I have to give my E-Mail address to an unproven/untrusted entity, despite nothing having been demonstrated....but I wasn't put off.   3) Signed up reluctantly. Game loaded very slowly and laucnhed into a poor, somewhat incoherent, pale immitation to the intro to Lord of The Rings.....but I wasn't put off.  4) Changed AA setting and was told game would have to restart. Started to get put off.  5) Restarted game. Took ages to start up.....again. Getting more put off now.  6) Chose to execute Tutorial. Tutorial turned out to be more like a 90s infomercial, crammed into a tiny little box about half the size of my screen (?). Now I'm beginning to get irritated.  7) Attempted to move my character as directed in the tutorial. Spent 10 minutes trying to move character. Failed. Extremely annoyed by now.   8) Figured #6 must be a bug so exited and restarted game. Waited again. Game crashed. Deleted. Never again. Absolutely appaling and pathetic. 1 Hour of my life I'll never get back and an unwarranted invasion of privacy.

Game crashes frequently. So much so that from now do you think of giving up ... I also play starts extremely slowly ... I guess all maps in the game opened up the game 'dB' is swelling. This is very boring. In a game that should not be sold on these errors.

The same happened with me.  Free to play and try out on 3/2/2015. Download went great but when I went to start up the game...you have to have a stardock account.   No problem, go to create one....error, contact Stardock. And again...and again.  10/10 Would downvote again for silly and unnesscary registration process.

I have the same problems with this sequel - Windows stopped working - mostly when I want to reload something or multiple events occur. It was fun while I played the scenario but at the end I got fed up with all the errors and reloading. I ran it under Vista and this is the first game ever I have such major problems with. A game with 2 full revisions shouldn't have such problems at all !!! Coincidental or not, but my laptop screen got nervous of this game (bleeding !?) and the screen is now broke. Luckily I had an old monitor so I could connect it and send out this warning. A pity, really . . . I really dislike giving negative reviews :-(

game Developer BANNING people from the forums   there are MODS for this game if you want to have better graphic better sound etc  people on the forums give me the links for these mods then the developer banned me for 'not likeing his game' so i wont say more, just know that if you buy this there are mods to make it a more enjoyable experience, and if you go to forums you get banned
game wont load !
One of the worst games I have ever played.
Played a few hours on this, but just kept asking my self. Why not just play Civ or even warlock masters of the arcane. There deeper and more fun.
Steam: 'Free weekend' Me: 'Looks great' installing... Stardock: 'Please give us your email address' Me: Uninstalling...
This was wasted money, recommendation: DON'T BUY!!! 1/5
Game crashes within 15 minutes of starting a game.  Basically unplayable, as its a long-term strategic game.
Meh. An unpolished, unbalanced buggy mess.
Stardock still cannot into videogames. Not really an improvement over Fallen Enchantress, at best a sidegrade. Minor amount of new content. Don't do it, person reading this. Don't do it.
Just so so,I don't like this kind of game
This is one of those games that I bought and then wished I hadn't. I think it has some sort of cult following but I just thought it was crap. Might be a kids game but its difficult to tell sometimes
Good game, terrible company. Avoid, like the plague.
Installed game, asks for startdock password to register game (neccesary to play), request password reset, no email, request refund, uninstall game. 0/10 waste of time.

Boring game. I dont particularly like Civilization type games but I played Civ5 for 20hrs+ but this game is really boring compared to Civ5, even though I like RPG stuff that Civ5 dont really have... so gameplay is really boring to even spoil that one. I like turn based games in particular I dont really know why this game is so lousy.  Maybe it is the design elements. The castle building screen is so lousy. The immersion is lousy. I guess everything in this game is lousy. The battles are lousy. The graphics in the battle is so lousy that I cant understand an old game like Kings Bounty have a better battle screen than this. And I wanted to really like this game too.  I suggest a better game - Eador - Masters of the Broken World. Many complain because of bugs but its more of the first players that played that game. But that game rocks and many people who actually complained are playing it for 200-400 hrs+. Some even for 1000+ hrs. So that game is worth every cent. I cant review it here because I got it from GOG, so I just review it here in Fallen Enchantress coz I paid for this game hoping I may find another gem like Eador.. but it failed miserably.
Game has a moderate amount of bugs and didn't run well on my pc. Would have been upset had I not gotten it at 75%off.
